intro: Anerincleistus setulosus var. setulosus, commonly known as the hairy leaf orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its elongated, hairy leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining, nutrient-rich soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique foliage. The species is relatively rare in the wild, making it a sought-after plant among orchid enthusiasts.
